channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Releases Thousands of Martin Luther King Jr. Files
item.description: Historians said they saw little of note in the assassination records that President Trump disclosed despite opposition from most of Dr. King’s family.

item.title: TV Show Helps Identify Mother and Child Found Dead in Rome Park, and a Suspect
item.description: When two bodies were found in a popular Roman park, Italians wanted answers. A TV program specializing in missing people helped identify them, and a s...

item.title: China’s Problem With Competition: There’s Too Much of It
item.description: The Chinese government is taking steps to rein in what it calls “involution,” or excessive competition that is hurting local companies and fueling the...

item.title: Iran’s Leaders Turn to a New Brand of Nationalism After Israeli and U.S. Attacks
item.description: The theocratic government is repurposing folklore and patriotic anthems as it seeks to channel national outrage into increasing its support at home.

item.title: Sharing a Bed With Your Kid? It’s Totally Normal in Asia.
item.description: Bed sharing tends to be unpopular and contentious in the United States. But in many Asian countries, the question is often not whether to do it, but w...

item.title: Tuesday Briefing: A Deadly Jet Crash in Bangladesh
item.description: Plus, New Zealand wines with something extra.

item.title: In Japan, Anti-Establishment Parties Resonate With Young Voters
item.description: Anti-establishment parties focused on wages, immigration and an unresponsive political elite struck a chord with working-age people in Japan.

item.title: Iran’s Leaders Turn to a New Brand of Nationalism After Israeli and U.S. Attacks

item.title: Astronomer’s new interim CEO breaks his silence after the tech company’s viral scandal shook the internet

item.title: James Gunn said he thought his ‘career was over’ when Disney fired him: ‘I didn’t think I was gonna make another dime in this industry’
item.description: "This started out as the worst day of my life, but I actually think it's the best day of my life," Gunn recalled thinking on the day he was fired.

item.title: Stocks hit fresh all-time highs as strong earnings continue to power market rally
item.description: After the first week of this earnings season, 73% of companies beat per-share profit estimates, above the first-week average of 68%, according to BofA...

item.title: Scott Bessent turns up the heat on the Fed, demands probe as Powell’s future hangs in balance
item.description: "What we need to do is examine the entire Federal Reserve institution and whether they have been successful," Bessent told CNBC's Squawk Box.

item.title: $61.5 billion tech giant Anthropic has made a major hiring U-turn—now, it’s letting job applicants use AI months after banning it from the interview process
item.description: Job seekers hoping to score a role at Anthropic can now refine their resumes, cover letters, and applications with AI—but there’s more catches.
